item.title: Create Pastebin-like app in Angular/Spring Boot
item.description: Okay. So I’m mostly Python guy, but I’ve recently applied for a Junior Java Developer job. I have some commercial experience with it (more than Python, to be honest) but my skills got rusty, so I decided to create a little project to sharpen them. It took me about a week to come up with The Pastinator - a Pastebin-like app written in Angular/Spring Boot. Everything you need is in video description.

Host a Flask app using Apache and mod_wsgi
item.description: Now that dust has settled after Youtube Thumbnail Downloader tutorial, it’s time for a new thing. When you run a Flask developement server, it tells you that it isn’t suited for prodution: WARNING: This is a developlment server. Do not use it in a production deployment. Fair point. It hasn’t been tested for security and whatnot. There are a few alternatives, most notably Nginx and Apache. I go for the latter.

item.title: Create your own Youtube Thumbnail Downloader in Python
item.description: The idea is pretty simple. Given the URL to a Youtube video, the script spews out it’s thumbnail. See this lovely image? It would make for a perfect wallpaper and I wrote a script that does just that. How would Python render it possible, you’d ask? By working hand-in-hand with Youtube API, of course! I should seriously reconsider becoming a clown. I have a hunch that it would come as natural to me.
